Text: spread option modelPlease see attached summary sheet The intrinsic value is the value of the basin spread and the extrinsic is the volatility time value The correlation being assumed minimizes extrinsic value so we are only looking at the value of the spread from onward Results are that the basin curves impley over bb in continuing value past Assuming in debt that provides a PV equity value of bb Add to that the PV of the current contracts approx mm and youve got a total equity value of approximately bb This is reasonably consistent with the model if we adjust it to include max rates as the basin curve valuation suggests you should do Best Davis

tw subscription rolloff templateI have attached a template to use to summarize the capacity rolloff issue discussed today I just filled in a bunch of numbers as an example if they dont make any sense you can guess why Lindy if you could use this to fill in the required data then either Michael or I will incorporate it into the TW model Thanks Davis

RE Capacity on TWPLThanks This is great Original Message From Donoho Lindy Sent Tuesday February PM To Thames Davis Cc Harris Steven Subject Capacity on TWPL Here is a diagram of the general segment capacities on Transwestern for the past analysis Please let me know if you have any questions Thanks Lindy File TWMapCapsppt

RE updated Transwestern model Cc Lindy Current situation we are planning on subscribing of east leg capacity with currently under long term contracts therefore will be resubscribed at the max rate This produces the current total revenue figure of mm that is mm less than s subscription revenue On the phone you suggested increasing subscribed volumes in the East to produce an incremental mm in reservation revenue This takes the current subscription rate on the East from to Question Would this increase apply to only If so East subscription rates are in in in If we can subscribe more on the East in why not do it in If we do it in then we increase reservation revenue by mm also total reservation revenue in would be mm and in it would be mm still the mm hole We can discuss further at the meeting tomorrow am hdt Original Message From Donoho Lindy Sent Wednesday March PM To Thames Davis Howard Kevin A Cc Harris Steven Subject RE updated Transwestern model I see at the bottom of the Business Plan where Tracy has asked for written assumptions for the forecast from you Has this been completed Steve would like to see this by sometime tomorrow morning for his review before our meeting When will we have this Original Message From Thames Davis Sent Tuesday March AM To Hayslett Rod Geaccone Tracy Howard Kevin A Donoho Lindy Tu Denis Cc Ratner Michael Centilli James Subject updated Transwestern model Attached is the latest iteration on the Tranwestern model hdt File TWmodelraxls
pge equity swapI apologize but I noticed a formula mistake in the cash flows table that implied a ridiculous interest rate Corrected documents are below Best Davis
